metadata.case_name: N. H. Heble & Ors. v. State of Maharashtra & Ors.

facts.text: Prior to States Reorganisation on 1st November 1956, petitioners were confirmed Tehsildars in quondam State of Hyderabad, directly recruited via competitive examination.
Rules in Hyderabad: 1/3 Tehsildars by promotion, 2/3 direct recruitment. Both Tehsildars and Deputy Collectors were State cadres.
Notification by Rajpramukh of Hyderabad dated 15th September 1955: All vacancies in Deputy Collectors filled by promotion from Tehsildars.
States Reorganisation Act 1956 enacted 31st August 1956, effective 1st November 1956, created new State of Bombay from territories of Bombay, Hyderabad, Madhya Pradesh, Saurashtra, Kutch.
Government of Bombay Resolution dated 1st November 1956 divided new State into six divisions including Aurangabad Division (ex-Hyderabad territories + East Khandesh).
Allocated Government Servants Absorption, Seniority, Pay and Allowances Rules, 1957 (Rules of 1957) made under Art. 309 for absorption and seniority of allocated servants.

Government Resolution dated 21st October 1957: Tehsildars from ex-Hyderabad equated to confirmed Grade II Mamlatdars, absorbed w.e.f. 1st November 1956 in Aurangabad Division; Deputy Collectors equated similarly.

Rules of 30th July 1959: Appointment to Deputy Collectors 50% nomination (direct), 50% promotion from suitable Mamlatdars; proviso: half promotion vacancies for direct-recruited Mamlatdars with 7 years service.
In Writ Petition No. 845/1967 (Kapoor case), Bombay High Court on 23rd March 1968 declared second proviso to Rule 1 of 30th July 1959 Rules void under Art. 16.
Letter dated 18th October 1960 from Commissioner Aurangabad to first petitioner: Rules of 30th July 1959 not applicable to Marathwada officers, governed by ex-Hyderabad rules.
Rules of 19th November 1959 for Mamlatdars: 50% direct nomination, 50% promotion from subordinate revenue services (except Nagpur Division).
Cadre of Mamlatdars treated as divisional cadre by State Government; Deputy Collectors as State cadre. Common ground.

Promotion procedure: Annual divisional select lists by Review Committee; promotions as officiating Deputy Collectors division-wise; confirmations State-wide from combined seniority of officiating DCs.
Government Resolution dated 7th April 1961: Principles for divisional select lists of Mamlatdars fit for promotion to Deputy Collectors.
Petitioners promoted as officiating Deputy Collectors in Aurangabad Division on different dates; some junior allocated Mamlatdars from other divisions (ex-Bombay) promoted earlier.
Government Resolution dated 29th July 1963: Seniority of promoted officers by date of continuous officiation; inter se by rank in select list.
Writ petition filed on 14th July 1969 challenging seniority, rules, procedure.
Promotions admitted as provisional by State in affidavit para 55.

legal_issues.text: Whether gradation list of Mamlatdars/Tehsildars as on 1st November 1956 to be per GR 21st November 1941, or GR 29th July 1963 applicable.
Whether Rules of 30th July 1959 varied conditions of service of ex-Hyderabad Tehsildars without Central Govt approval under proviso to s.115(7) States Reorganisation Act.
Validity of second proviso to Rule 1 of Rules of 30th July 1959 reserving 25% promotion vacancies for direct-recruited Mamlatdars.
Whether cadre of Mamlatdars State or divisional; whether promotion procedure to Deputy Collectors (State cadre) via divisional select lists violates Art. 16.

petitioner_arguments.text: Gradation list of allocated Mamlatdars/Tehsildars as on 1st Nov 1956 per GR 21 Nov 1941; GR 29 Jul 1963 inapplicable.
Rules of 30 Jul 1959 varied conditions (reduced promotion chances from 100% to 50%) without Central approval under proviso s.115(7) SRA.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Proviso to s.115(7) States Reorganisation Act 1956

petitioner_arguments.text: Second proviso to Rule 1 of 30 Jul 1959 valid; Bombay HC erred in Kapoor case.
Mamlatdars State cadre; promotions to Deputy Collectors (State cadre) must be statewide, not divisional select lists; GR 7 Apr 1961 and procedure violate Art. 16.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Art. 16 Constitution; Bombay Civil Services Classification Rules

respondent_arguments.text: Petition barred by laches (delay 10-12 years); procedure from 1956/1961.
Alternative remedy: review Kapoor judgment as class issue decided.
Necessary parties (other Mamlatdars supporting procedure) absent.
Mamlatdars divisional cadre per GR 1 Nov 1956; promotion procedure valid under Art. 16; Rules 30 Jul 1959 unified and applicable.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Art. 162; Rules of 1957; Ram Saran v. DIG Police

respondent_arguments.text: Letter 18 Oct 1960 erroneous, not binding; no variation of conditions affecting chances of promotion.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: State of Mysore v. B. Purohit

court_reasoning.text: Rejected laches: Misled by letters till Kapoor; procedure ongoing; promotions provisional, no vested rights disturbed; Art.32 claim.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Delay explained; no prejudice to innocents.

court_reasoning.text: Rejected alternative remedy: No locus for review; different issues; not adequate.
Rejected necessary parties: All affected promoted parties before court.
Ground A rejected: Seniority per Rules 1957 r.7-9, not 1941/1963 GRs.
court_reasoning.key_observation: GRs inapplicable to allocated inter se seniority.

court_reasoning.text: Ground B: No variation of conditions; chances of promotion not condition of service. Second proviso invalid under Art.16 as discriminates direct vs promotee Mamlatdars.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Follows Purohit; direct/promotee same class per Meryn Coutinho, S.M. Pandit.

court_reasoning.text: Mamlatdars divisional cadre per GR 1 Nov 1956, Rules 19 Nov 1959; Deputy Collectors State cadre. Procedure: divisional select lists for officiating, then state confirmation via deemed dates - violates Art.16.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Denies equal opportunity; entry depends on divisional vacancies, not merit/seniority statewide.

court_reasoning.text: Distinguishes Ram Saran: There range cadre promotion from range pool; here State cadre from divisional pools invalid.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No intermediate officiating cadre per Rules 30 Jul 1959.

holdings.text: Second proviso to Rule 1 Rules 30 Jul 1959 void under Art.16.
Promotion procedure and GR 7 Apr 1961 invalid under Art.16; promotions to be statewide on merit-cum-seniority from common list.
Direct State to readjust promotions/confirmations retrospectively; petitioners get seniority/pay/allowances from due dates, no arrears pre-petition.

precedents_cited.relevance: Laches discretionary, depends on facts; no inviolable rule.

precedents_cited.case_name: Shivdeo Singh v. State of Punjab
precedents_cited.relevance: Review available only if necessary party.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Mysore v. B. Purohit
precedents_cited.relevance: Chances of promotion not condition of service.

precedents_cited.case_name: Mervyn Coutinho v. Collector of Customs
S.M. Pandit v. State of Gujarat
precedents_cited.relevance: Direct/promotee Mamlatdars same class under Art.16.

precedents_cited.case_name: B.N. Nagarajan v. State of Mysore
precedents_cited.relevance: Executive power under Art.162 to decide cadre structure absent rules.

precedents_cited.case_name: Sant Ram v. State of Rajasthan
Ram Saran v. Deputy Inspector General of Police
precedents_cited.relevance: Divisionwise promotion valid for divisional/range cadre with local knowledge; not for State cadre.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Art.32 for writ; Art.16 equality in promotion; Art.309/162 for rules/cadre.

statutes_cited.name: States Reorganisation Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Proviso requires Central approval for varying conditions of allocated servants.

statutes_cited.name: Police Act, 1861
statutes_cited.relevance: In Ram Saran: Statewide police force but tiered promotion valid.

outcome.summary: Court rejected grounds A and B partially but upheld invalidity of second proviso; declared promotion procedure/GR 7 Apr 1961 invalid under Art.16; directed readjustment of promotions/confirmations retrospectively per statewide merit-cum-seniority; costs to petitioners.
outcome.relief_granted: Readjust promotions w.e.f. due dates; seniority/pay/allowances; no arrears pre-petition filing.
outcome.costs: First respondent to pay costs of petition to petitioners.

key_quotes.text: The procedure followed by the State Government in making promotions must, therefore, be held to be violative of Art. 16 of the Constitution.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on equality of opportunity in promotions to State cadre.

key_quotes.text: Chances of promotion are not conditions of service.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects variation claim under SRA s.115(7).

key_quotes.text: There must be one common door for entry into the cadre of Deputy Collectors through which every Mamlatdar should be equally entitled to enter.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains Art.16 violation in divisional promotion to State cadre.

key_quotes.text: Legal rules must govern the recruitment and conditions of public servants so that there is no arbitrariness or inequality in State action.
key_quotes.speaker: court
